Photo: St. Francis Middle School students contemplating an experiment
Photo: SFES students doing classwork with the help of an iPad

header.h2: Welcome to St. Francis Area Schools

div.p: Our mission is to equip all students with the knowledge and skills to empower them to achieve their dreams and full potential while becoming responsible citizens in a dynamic world.

It is an exciting time for St. Francis Area Schools. With the passing of the 2017-2021 Construction Bond, school buildings within the district are receiving a needed facelift. For more information on building construction click here.

ul.li: St. Francis Area Schools closed March 30-May 4

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsSlideshow fsThumbnailRectangle fsThumbnailLarge fsItemCount_0 fsSlideshowHorizontal

div.a: School playgrounds, fields, tennis courts, track closed to the public

div.p: Given the difficulty in maintaining the sanitization of playground equipment and the volume/frequency of students gathering, all St. Francis Area Schools playgrounds, fields, tennis courts and track are closed to the public until further notice. Click title to read more.
During this time of uncertainty, it is important that our students and families know that your mental health support staff are available for questions and support. Click title to read more.
Distance Learning will continue to the end of the 2019-2020 school year for all St. Francis Area Schools students. Visit the Distance Learning webpage for more information.
Visit the Coronavirus Information page to stay up-to-date on school district news. Click title to read more.
Kindergarten Registration packets for the 2020-21 school year are now available! Click the title to read more.

div.title: Art: St. Francis Area Schools We're Hiring

img.alt: Art: St. Francis Area Schools We're Hiring

div.p: St. Francis Area Schools, a PreK-12 public school district, is a great employer and is currently looking for team members.
Apply online anytime at www.isd15.org/jobs. Call 763-753-7040 with questions.
Keep your receipts and save money when you file your taxes! The K-12 Education Credit and Subtraction can lower the tax you pay or increase your refund when filing your Minnesota income tax return.

div.title: Items needed for Kody's Closet @ SFHS

img.alt: Items needed for Kody's Closet @ SFHS

div.a: Items needed for Kody's Closet @ SFHS

div.p: St. Francis High School is holding a clothing drive to fill Kody's Closet, a resource within the school where students can take items home for themselves and their families.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

article.h2: Distance Learning continues at St. Francis Area Schools through end of school year

div.p: Distance Learning at St. Francis Area Schools will continue through the end of the 2019-2020 school year due to the Coronavirus outbreak.

Grab-and-Go meals are available free of charge for all community members age 18 and younger. Parents/guardians need to fill out the Emergency Services Request Form to receive the service. Starting March 30, distribution is on Mondays and Thursdays.

Childcare will be provided at no cost to emergency services workers' families (Tier 1). Register at https://district15.ce.eleyo.com, select Youth Grades K-12 Start Exploring > Emergency Childcare. Call 763-213-1641 with questions.

p.span: Call the Saints Hotline at 763-753-7157 if you have questions.
